page.title: 01Location of Gwydelwern
page.content: The village of Gwyddelwern is 2 miles north of{Corwen}and 10 miles south of {Ruthin. Llangollen}lies 9 miles to the west and{Bala,}famous for its lake is 10 miles to the S. West. The main road from Corwen to Ruthin runs through the village and connects with the A.5 at Corwen. The nearest large city is{Chester,}situated to the north. The village of Gwyddelwern is set amongst farmland. The area extends to a disused stone quarry on the northside, to the south the{River Dee. Betws Gwerfyl Goch borders the west side, while to the east are hills. The{population of this area is about {500}and most of the community have farming connections. Gwyddelwern has a pre-reformation church, 2 chapels, PostOffice/shop, Junior school, Garage and Public House. M. Johns.
